remarks: As shown in ~ diagval , the currying of the first projection is the diagonal functor.  On the other hand, the currying of the second projection is ` x e. C |-> ( y e. D |-> y ) ` , which is a constant functor of the identity functor at ` D ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jan-2017.)
statement:
curf2ndf.q $e |- Q = ( D FuncCat D ) $.
curf2ndf.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
curf2ndf.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. Cat ) $.
curf2ndf $p |- ( ph -> ( <. C , D >. curryF ( C 2ndF D ) ) = ( ( 1st ` ( Q DiagFunc C ) ) ` ( idFunc ` D ) ) ) $.
